name: Cairo Pyramids
description: Cairo is the capital and largest city of Egypt, known for its ancient pyramids, the Great Sphinx, and rich Islamic heritage. The city combines ancient wonders with modern urban development, featuring the iconic Giza pyramids and historic Islamic architecture.

name: Antananarivo Palace
description: Antananarivo is the capital and largest city of Madagascar, known for its historic royal palace complex and rich cultural heritage. The city combines traditional Malagasy culture with colonial architecture, featuring the iconic Rova palace complex and the vibrant Analakely market district.

name: Casablanca Hassan II Minaret
description: Casablanca is the largest city in Morocco, known for its iconic Hassan II Mosque with its distinctive minaret. The city combines traditional Moroccan culture with modern development, featuring the historic medina, the modern Corniche waterfront, and the impressive Hassan II Mosque complex.

name: Lagos Bridge
description: Lagos is the largest city and economic hub of Nigeria, known for its modern infrastructure including iconic bridges, bustling port, and vibrant culture. The city combines traditional Nigerian culture with contemporary development, featuring the Third Mainland Bridge, Victoria Island, and dynamic street life.

name: Marrakesh Koutoubia Mosque
description: Marrakesh is a historic city in Morocco, known for its iconic Koutoubia Mosque and vibrant medina. The city combines traditional Moroccan culture with historic architecture, featuring the famous Jemaa el-Fnaa square, historic palaces, and the Atlas Mountains backdrop.

name: Cape Town Table Mountain
description: Cape Town is the legislative capital of South Africa, known for its iconic Table Mountain and stunning natural beauty. The city combines African culture with modern development, featuring the Cape of Good Hope, Robben Island, and vibrant multicultural scene.

name: Benghazi Lighthouse
description: Benghazi is the second-largest city in Libya, known for its iconic Benghazi Lighthouse (Fanar Benghazi) - a historic coastal landmark. The city combines Mediterranean charm with rich cultural heritage, featuring the beautiful Mediterranean coastline, historic architecture, the famous Benghazi University, and vibrant local markets.

name: Fez Moroccan Hat
description: Fez is one of Morocco's oldest and most important cities, known for its traditional Moroccan fez hat and rich cultural heritage. The city combines medieval architecture with vibrant culture, featuring the famous Fes el-Bali medina (a UNESCO World Heritage site), the beautiful Al-Qarawiyyin University (the world's oldest university), and the iconic tanneries.

name: Lalibela Cross Church
description: Lalibela is home to the famous rock-hewn churches, including the iconic Church of Saint George carved in the shape of a cross. These UNESCO World Heritage churches represent one of Ethiopia's most sacred pilgrimage sites and showcase the remarkable architectural achievements of medieval Ethiopian Orthodox Christianity.

name: African Renaissance Monument
description: Dakar is the capital and largest city of Senegal, home to the iconic African Renaissance Monument - a 49-meter bronze statue that stands as the tallest statue in Africa. Built in 2010, this striking monument depicts a family emerging from a mountain and symbolizes Africa's liberation from centuries of colonialism and slavery, representing hope, progress, and the rebirth of the African continent.

name: KICC Tower
description: Nairobi is the capital and largest city of Kenya, featuring the iconic Kenyatta International Convention Centre (KICC) tower. This distinctive 28-story cylindrical tower with its unique architectural design has defined Nairobi's skyline since 1973, serving as a symbol of Kenya's post-independence development and its role as East Africa's premier business and conference hub.

name: Maseru Basotho Hat Monument
description: Maseru is the capital of Lesotho, home to the iconic Basotho Hat (Mokorotlo) monument - a distinctive conical straw hat that has become the national symbol of the Mountain Kingdom. This traditional headwear, inspired by the shape of Mount Qiloane, represents Basotho cultural identity and pride. The monument celebrates Lesotho's unique heritage as Africa's only country entirely above 1,000 meters, where the Mokorotlo remains an everyday symbol of national identity.

name: Accra Independence Arch
description: Accra is the vibrant capital of Ghana, home to the iconic Independence Arch at Black Star Square. Built in 1961 to commemorate Ghana's independence as the first sub-Saharan African nation to gain freedom from colonial rule, the arch draws inspiration from the Arc de Triomphe. Crowned with a black star — Ghana's national symbol of African emancipation — the monument stands at the heart of Independence Square, the country's largest public gathering space and a powerful symbol of pan-African pride.
